H0.text: What is the mechanism by which carbon dioxide heats Earth is the question that would best help scientists assess the claim that humans are responsible for the rising global temperature, given that scientists think the rise in global temperature during the last one hundred years is due to an increase of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.

H1.text: The question “What is the source of most of the carbon dioxide in the atmosphere?” is the best question to help scientists assess the claim that humans are responsible for the rising global temperature, given that scientists think the rise in global temperature during the last one hundred years is due to an increase of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.

H2.text: What is the source of the increase of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere? is the question that would best help scientists assess the claim that humans are responsible for the rising global temperature.

H3.text: What is the increase in the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere? is the question that would best help scientists assess the claim that humans are responsible for the rising global temperature, given that scientists think the rise in global temperature during the last one hundred years is due to an increase of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.

A5.text: The increase in atmospheric concentrations of CO2 and other long-lived greenhouse gases such as methane increase the absorption and emission of infrared radiation by the atmosphere. This has led to a rise in average global temperature and ocean acidification.
